title: New Rooms Hotel Kokhta
body:
Adjara Group’s new property, Rooms Hotel Kokhta, will be hosting first guests for the New Year! 

Adjara Group is opening a new Rooms Hotel in the picturesque mountainous region of Kokhta-Mitarbi. The ski-in/ski-out hotel, nestled under the mount Kokhta, is a combination of rustic charm and traditional luxury. The hotel has a unique rooftop lounge bar with a spectacular panoramic view. Extensive terraces connected with indoor public spaces together with a swimming pool, spa and restaurants make it a perfect retreat for all types of mountain lovers.

Rooms Hotel Kokhta will include

  • 95 guestrooms;
  • Conference halls;
  • A restaurant, lounge bar and a terrace;
  • A swimming pool, gym and spa.

It is now possible to book a room at Rooms Hotel Kokhta and welcome the New Year in majestic surroundings of mountainous landscapes and snow covered pine trees.
description: Adjara Group is opening a new Rooms Hotel in the picturesque mountainous region of Kokhta-Mitarbi.

title: New Project in the Historic Resort of Abastumani
body:
Located in Southern Georgia, Abastumani stands out for its exceptional nature, unique climatic conditions and thermal waters with healing powers.

The iconic building of an old sanatorium, initially constructed in 1924, will be transformed into Rooms Hotel Abastumani. Nestled in the woods with exquisite forest views, the hotel will focus on health and wellness.

True to the company’s signature approach, the building will be restored and reconstructed while preserving its original character and paying homage to its legacy. 

Rooms Abastumani will be the fifth hotel of the Rooms brand after Kazbegi (2012), Tbilisi (2014), Kokhta (2019) and Batumi (2020).
description: Adjara Group announces the development of a new project in the historic resort of Abastumani

title: Traditional Georgian Supra in Paris
body:
To celebrate the long-lasting friendship between Georgia and France, the company Adjara Group has recreated a traditional Georgian Supra in Paris. It was an occasion for French guests to become familiar with the Georgian cuisine, wine, art and music. 

Indeed, in a beautiful Parisian house, in the heart of the historic neighborhood of Saint Germain des Pres, two long tables decorated with peonies and chandeliers were set to welcome around sixty guests all of whom were pioneers in their respective fields. Paris based representatives of art, fashion, media, hospitality, real estate, lifestyle development, gastronomy, cinema and photography have been introduced to the Georgian culture and traditions.

See the full story here
description: To celebrate the long-lasting friendship between Georgia and France, the company Adjara Group has recreated a traditional Georgian Supra in Paris.

title: Tbilisi Photography & Multimedia Museum Now Open
body:
Tbilisi Photography & Multimedia Museum, founded by Nestan Nizharadze and Tusi Kapanadze, opened its doors to the public on September 16th 2019.  

The museum opened with a video installation by a duo of French artists - Vincent Moon & Priscilla Telmon - Unus Mundus: Rituals and Trances. The installation was accompanied with live music.

Adjara Group, known for promoting Georgian art, has played a significant role in the development of a large-scale cultural project of regional importance. An expansive space at Stamba Hotel is now dedicated to Tbilisi Photography & Multimedia Museum, which is the first institution in South Caucasus to focus on contemporary imagery through various forms. Exhibitions and art installations will be renewed continuously while certain multimedia materials, from across the world, will be archived and kept permanently. The museum is created as part of the “South Caucasus Photography Hub for Education and Innovation” funded by Swiss Cooperation Office in South Caucasus.
description: Tbilisi Photography & Multimedia Museum, founded by Nestan Nizharadze and Tusi Kapanadze, opened its doors to the public on September 16th 2019

title: Radio City - Creative Economy
body: The project aims at integrating artists, manufacturers, educators, entrepreneurs and professionals of diverse backgrounds into a synergistic ecosystem. Radio City's territory is an extensive 12 hectares, which will be used - amongst others – for international festivals, exhibitions, art fairs, artists residencies, co-working spaces, creative ateliers and studios.
description: Adjara Group is transforming the former radio factory in Tbilisi’s Mukhiani neighborhood into a new creative economy platform.

title: Adjara Group's Charity Initiative
body:
Adjara Group has been joined by Wolt and Glovo in supporting the Fund 1anoba. From every order placed for Lolita and Café Stamba on Wolt and Glovo platforms 2 Gel is transferred to the Fund. Half of each donation is covered by Adjara Group and the other half is contributed by the platform which takes the order.  

The Fund 1anoba brings together volunteers who deliver food, medication and other essentials to vulnerable groups of the population, including people with disabilities, single mothers, the low-income elderly, and many others, who are struggling to survive through this uncertain time.   

One can now enjoy our dishes from Lolita and Café Stamba using Wolt and Glovo applications while also supporting those who are the most in need of our help!
description: Adjara Group has been joined by Wolt and Glovo in supporting the Fund 1anoba.

title: #TOGETHER by Adjara Group Now Live
body:
Adjara Group has joined the UNTWO’s #TravelTomorrow campaign with a new initiative. The #Together platform is now live and offers hotel and restaurant vouchers to the company’s guests all over the world. 

The main objective of the initiative is to help the big family of Adjara Group’s employees in overcoming the hardships that the Novel Coronavirus has created. Additionally, the company acknowledges that the vulnerable communities in Georgia are in dire need of support. For this reason, part of the income generated by the #Together platform will be donated to the 1anoba Fund. 

To ensure their health and well-being, billions of people are staying at home during the COVID-19 pandemic. International travel has been halted and the hospitality industry is facing unprecedented challenges. 

Nevertheless, we believe that we will meet each other in the future and create outstanding experiences together. So, stay home today, travel tomorrow!
description: Adjara Group has joined the UNTWO’s #TravelTomorrow campaign with a new initiative.

title: Our Establishments Opening in June
body:
In June, Adjara Group opens your favorite restaurants, cafes, and hotels 

We wish to thank our guests, friends, and partners for their ongoing support and loyalty. We miss you very much and we are looking forward to seeing you soon again. 

It is our great pleasure to announce that from June 7th, we will be welcoming you at Lolita, Cafe Stamba, and outdoor restaurants of Rooms Hotel Tbilisi and Rooms Hotel Kokhta as well as at Fabrika’s courtyard. And from June 15th, Rooms Hotel Kazbegi and Rooms Hotel Kokhta will open for guests again. 

The Covid-19 pandemic has created many challenges for all of us and now more than ever, we must care for each other. The well-being of our guests and employees is of paramount importance to us. Therefore, we have been working tirelessly on new health and safety regulations to ensure a safe and protected environment for everyone.  

Adjara Group has been actively involved in addressing challenges caused by the coronavirus through which the company gained significant experience and knowledge. As you may know, Adjara Group’s largest hotel, Holiday Inn Tbilisi, became a quarantine zone for returning citizens for a mandatory self-isolation period. Moreover, our restaurants, strictly adhering to all necessary safety standards, were operating take-away services. 

Indeed, we’ve been able to overcome many difficulties by actively working and fully complying with the instructions of the Georgian government, World Health Organization, as well as the World Tourism Organisation. We believe that together we will overcome today’s challenges and continue to create unique hospitality and culinary experiences in the spirit of our traditional warmth and energy.
description: In June, Adjara Group opens your favorite restaurants, cafes, and hotels

title: The Udabno Project’s Alternative Employment Program
body:
We are now reopening our restaurants, bars and hotels, which we had to temporarily put on hold due to the recent global developments. While many of our establishments and projects had to be closed we gave our employees opportunities to keep working and earn a continuous income. 

We created an alternative employment program through the Udabno initiative - our innovative large-scale agricultural development project in the region of Kakheti. This gives our employees the possibility to explore farming, learn more about agriculture, and take part in cultivation of almond orchards as well as of various berry cultures and unique grape varieties. 

From picking strawberries to taking care of our farm animals many exciting positions were offered to our employees while our hotels and F&B outlets remained closed. 

The Udabno Project is developing 5,000 hectares of land in the Sagarejo municipality of Kakheti. Currently, we have a 2,000 hectare almond orchard, berry fields, and vineyards. Recently, we brought Mediterranean buffalos, Alpine goats, and chickens to develop a dairy and poultry farm.
description: We are now reopening our restaurants, bars and hotels, which we had to temporarily put on hold due to the recent global developments.

title: COVID-19 UPDATE
body:
Georgian public and private institutions have been working tirelessly to tackle the COVID-19 outbreak in the country.  As a result, Georgia is now internationally recognized as a “green zone”, safe for travel. Currently, there are less than 160 active cases of COVID-19. 

The tourism industry is gradually resuming in the country through local tourism. Authorities are currently working on a safe plan to reopen international borders.

The hospitality sector has an important responsibility of minimizing any health risks at hotels, restaurants, bars, and other establishments. 

Our close collaboration with the Georgian government and UNWTO throughout the pandemic helped shape safety standards for the Georgian hospitality industry. Our new regulations ensure physical distancing, prioritize enhanced cleanliness, promote personal hygiene, and make it possible to immediately identify any health threats within our facilities.

To learn more about our new Health Safety Standards and Norms, Click Here.
description: Travel Updates & Health Safety

title: Hosting Events Resumed
body:
More great news! We have resumed hosting events at Stamba Hotel, Rooms Hotel Tbilisi, and Holiday Inn Tbilisi in accordance with the new health and safety regulations. 

Currently, meetings, conferences, public talks, panels, trainings, and seminars, can be held at our outdoor, as well as indoor, spaces.

Carefully tailored catering services with farm-to-table menus are designed to fit the needs and requirements of every occasion. Focusing on regional ingredients – the company uses fresh and seasonal produce to create sophisticated canapes, delicate small plates, and fine dining. 

Indeed, with extensive in-house capabilities and resources, the company has grown into one of the key players of the country’s events industry. Each occasion is special and we work passionately to create tailor-made environments and ambiance. And now more than ever we are eager to go back to providing new and unique experiences.

description: Hosting Events Resumed at Stamba Hotel, Rooms Hotel Tbilisi & Holiday Inn Tbilisi

title: Our Contribution to 1anoba
body:
Adjara Group has raised 30,000GEL for the 1anoba Fund which is a platform for volunteers to come together and help vulnerable communities to overcome unprecedented challenges caused by the Covid-19 crisis.

The funds were partly collected through the ongoing partnership with Glovo and Wolt. The donation money was also raised from the vouchers sold on the Adjara Group’s #TOGETHER platform. The company has increased its contribution by supporting a charity concert organized by Adjarabet and Rustavi 2.

30,000 GEL raised throughout the March-June period, has already assisted over 1,000 families with medication, food, and other essential products. The fund is also providing long-term support to a number of families facing hardships as a result of a recent passing or illness of a family member.

The 1anoba Fund was initiated in March 2020, by the CEO of Adjara Group Valeri Chekheria, Georgian Farmers’ Association Chairwoman Nino Zambakhidze, and Business Accelerator Spark Manager Sandro Kandelaki.

Today, 2,000 volunteers and 7,000 vulnerable families looking for support are registered on the 1anoba Fund’s website. As a result of donations from individuals, businesses, and organizations, more than 6,000 families living in Georgia have already received assistance.
description: Adjara Group’s Contribution to the 1anoba Fund

title: Adjara Group Academy’s new project
body:
The Culinary School, part of the Adjara Group Academy, is now open for applications until August 17. Applicants have the opportunity to choose from the following two programs: Beginner Chef and Beginner Pastry Chef. 

The program, while continuing for 7 months covers both theoretical and practical elements of the chosen course. Lectures will be led by Georgian as well as international chefs and culinary experts. 

Practical training will be conducted at the professionally equipped kitchens of Adjara Group’s hotels both in Tbilisi and across regions. Students trained outside Tbilisi will be staying at Rooms Hotel Kazbegi and Rooms Hotel Kokhta. 

Adjara Group recognizes the importance of education as the very foundation for advancing the socio-economic development of the country. Therefore, in 2019 the company initiated the Adjara Group Academy, which currently combines two main entities - Learning and Development Center and Vocational Education Unit. 

for further information visit the website of the Adjara Group Academy.

Beginner Chef and Beginner Pastry Chef programs are financially supported by TBC Bank.
description: The Culinary School, part of the Adjara Group Academy, is now open for applications until August 17.

title: Adjara Group and Visa’s joint campaign
body:
Adjara Group and Visa have become partners and are planning various activities aimed at encouraging domestic tourism. The joint Times Like These campaign’s initiation event was held yesterday at the Stamba Hotel rooftop. Adjara Group and Visa’s partner companies, media representatives, and organizations attended the event.  

The campaign echoes the challenges that the global hospitality industry has been facing in 2020 by taking a creative approach to communicating them. Hence, Times Like These is a sort of an invitation for Georgian residents to rediscover and get to know Georgia again. 

As part of the campaign, Visa cardholders will be offered a complimentary stay when booking a room for one night at Rooms Hotels in Kazbegi and Kokhta-Mitarbi. Additionally, when ordering a cocktail at Cafe Stamba, Rooms Garden Bar, and Lolita, Visa cardholders will receive another cocktail as a gift from.  Adjara Group and Visa. 

The Times Like These campaign also includes a photography project. Outstanding Georgian photographers with signature artistic styles will travel to four destinations within the country and document unique spaces, as well as history, to construct photo-stories. Hence, times like these will be documented in Kazbegi, Bakuriani, Abastumani, and Adjara, where authentic and peaceful adventures filled with happiness awaits us.
image: /assets/img/articles/Times Like These – Adjara Group and Visa’s joint campaign.webp
description: Times Like These - Adjara Group and Visa’s joint campaign

title: Exciting new changes at Adjara Group
body:
We have the pleasure to announce a number of changes at Adjara Group. Throughout the last years, our company has grown greatly, and the time has now come to turn towards an exciting new path.

A new holding company – Adjara Group Holding – has been established. It incorporates hospitality, agropreneurship and various developments. The holding is headed by the board of directors, which defines strategic plans of the company.

These are exciting times for us, and we are thrilled to meet new challenges with much enthusiasm and passion. New directions, innovative projects and unique developments await us.

description: Adjara Group turns toward a new path

title: Campaign against gender-based violence
body:
Today, on 25th of November, the 16 days of activism against gender-based violence kicks off and the whole world unites around this special cause.

The dates for the campaign were chosen to link violence against women and human rights and emphasize that gender-based violence against women is a violation of human rights: since 1991, the campaign has been active between November 25, the International Day Against Violence Against Women, and December 10, International Human Rights Day.

Private sector has a key role in tackling gender-based violence in the world of work. We, the signatory companies of the Women’s Empowerment Principles, are committed to the achievement of gender equality and acknowledge that this goal cannot be achieved without the elimination of gender-based violence. We are taking bold steps to advance women’s empowerment and gender equality by promoting awareness about these issues and about the available services for women and girls affected by gender-based violence.

We, the signatory companies of Women’s Empowerment Principles, join the global campaign against gender-based violence and once again uphold the shared values of gender equality and women’s empowerment.
description: Adjara Group joins the annual global campaign against gender-based violence

title: Adjara Group Holding receives a Gender Equality Award
body:
On March 25, the Millennium Foundation hosted annual Business for Gender Equality award ceremony. We are happy to announce that Adjara Group Holding has won a prize in this competition for the second time.

“Adjara Group is a member of the United Nations Global Compact initiative and a signatory to the UN Women’s Empowerment Principles (WEPs), for which achieving gender equality at all levels is a top priority.

The company has integrated women’s empowerment principles into business values ​​and decision-making processes. Currently, the general managers of all the companies in the Holding are women," the jury said in a statement.

We want to thank the Millennium Foundation and UN Women for their invaluable work in helping women achieve their goals and for encouraging companies that foster women’s professional development.
description: We are happy to announce that Adjara Group Holding has won a prize in this competition for the second time.

title: USAID Georgia Mission  Director Visits Rooms Hotel Abastumani
body:
Tbilisi, April 23, 2021 — As part of the ongoing partnership between Adjara Group Holding and USAID Economic Security Program, the USAID/Georgia Mission Director, Peter Wiebler visited Rooms Hotel Abastumani, The hotel’s potential for regional development, as well as the opportunities for expanding the partnership, were discussed during the meeting. 

Adjara Group Holding will invest approximately USD 13.5 million in the rehabilitation and development of the historic sanatorium, which is being transformed into Rooms Hotel Abastumani.  Currently, the company is working with Wings and Freeman Capital, to obtain financing from the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) to develop Rooms Hotel Abastumani.

Additionally, in partnership with the USAID Economic Security Program, the employees of Adjara Group Holding will be trained in health and wellness in adherence to the international standards. Through international technical assistance, the Program funding will also contribute to strengthening the safety measures at the hotel.

Rooms Hotel Abastumani will welcome its first guests in Winter, 2022. The project envisages to create around 150 employment opportunities and new, high-value jobs for local communities, thus significantly strengthening the economic development of the region.

Nestled within the coniferous forest with healing powers, Rooms Hotel Abastumani will feature approximately 76 guest rooms along with conference and meeting spaces. Its restaurant and bar will provide Adjara Group Holding’s signature farm-to-table gastronomic program with an emphasis on healthy food consumption.

Functionally, health and wellness will take center stage at Rooms Hotel Abastumani. The project implies creating facilities and programming aimed at promoting healthy lifestyle. Identifying and integrating international trends and the local context will play a crucial role in ensuring that high quality services and spaces are created for domestic and international guests looking to improve their physical, mental, as well as spiritual health.
description: Adjara Group Holding will invest approximately USD 13.5 million in the rehabilitation and development of the historic sanatorium, which is being transformed into Rooms Hotel Abastumani.

title: USAID and Adjara Group Launch New Partnership
body:
USAID/Georgia Mission Director Peter Wiebler and the directors of Adjara Group signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) on July 21, 2021, affirming their commitment to jointly advancing sustainable and inclusive economic development.

Under the MOU, Adjara Group and USAID will partner to strengthen the competitiveness of key sectors in Georgia’s economy including hospitality, creative industries, and agriculture. This partnership foresees developing workforce skills in key sectors, generating inclusive employment, supporting local business development, sourcing local produce, and co-investing in sustainable tourism in Abastumani and the wider Samtskhe-Javakheti region.

This initiative with Adjara Group will help USAID strengthen our ability to support inclusive economic growth in Georgia's communities, said USAID/Georgia Mission Director Peter Wiebler. The company has proven its commitment to investing in its employees and in the communities where it operates. Together, we will create and co-finance initiatives that create high-value jobs and strengthen resilience in Georgia's regions. This is a core priority for USAID as we support broad-based, inclusive economic growth that benefits people all across the country.

Creating an enabling environment for Georgia's increased employability and economic growth has always been one of our ultimate priorities. Inclusivity, a shared value approach, regional development, and empowerment of local communities are fundamental to all of our main directions. Today, we are glad to deepen our strategic partnership with USAID and advance the Holding's capacity for further contributing to the development of Georgia's tourism, agricultural and creative industries - the Board or Directors of Adjara Group.
description: USAID/Georgia Mission Director Peter Wiebler and the directors of Adjara Group signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) on July 21, 2021, affirming their commitment to jointly advancing sustainable and inclusive economic development.

title: Radio City to become a new multifunctional space in Tbilisi
body:
Adjara Group's development company Collective is creating Radio City, a new multifunctional space in Tbilis’s Gldani-Mukhiani district. As part of the project, a newly launched online platform radiocity.adjaragroup.com will further facilitate faster and effective stakeholder engagement and two-way communications contributing to an inclusive development process.

”The online platform will help us better understand the needs of guests and tenants of Radio City. Therefore, we are announcing an open call and would like to invite every interested party to join us in the process of creating Radio City together. ”- Oto Berishvili, Executive Director of Adjara Group’s development company Collective.

Radio City is an innovative project tailored to the interests of the public and communities. The renovated buildings of the former radio factory located in Gldani-Mukhiani will create a new and unique center of attraction for creative industries, SMEs, youth and innovators in Tbilisi.

”Together with the local population and representatives of small and medium enterprises, we are developing a collaborative environment that will create new economic opportunities. Radio City will become a space of recreation, entertainment, employment, leisure with friends and family, and possibly a place to deepen knowledge and acquire new skills." - Nato Japaridze, Executive Director of Adjara Group’s development company Collective.

The unique ecosystem of Radio City will include shared workspaces, shops, restaurants, bars, entertainment and event venues. The project will unite more than 10 industries, 35 sectors and will support more than 200 economic activities.
description: Adjara Group’s development company Collective is creating Radio City, a new multifunctional space in Tbilisi’s Gldani-Mukhiani district.
